title: Tour de France 2021 Standings after Stage 17
content:
General Classification / Yellow Jersey 

Today's mountain top finish saw a slight shake-up of the GC. Tadej Pogačar retained his big advantage over his rivals, but Vingegaard and Carapaz both moved up two places after Uran was distanced on the final climb. 

1. Tadej Pogačar
2. Jonas Vingegaard +5:39
3. Richard Carapaz +5:43
4. Rigoberto Uran +7:17
5. Ben O'Connor +7:34
6. Wilco Kelderman +8:06
7. Enric Mas +9:48
8. Enric Mas +10:04
9. Guillaume Martin +11:51
10. Pello Bilbao +12:53

Tour de France 2021 Guide

Points Classification / Green Jersey

Mark Cavendish keeps his lead in the Points Classification after finishing one place behind his closest rival, Michael Matthews, in today's only intermediate sprint.

1. Mark Cavendish - 287 points
2. Michael Matthews - 251 points
3. Sonny Colbrelli - 201 points
4. Jasper Philipsen - 178 points
5. Julian Alaphilippe - 135 points

The Tour de France jerseys – the race so far

King of the Mountains Classification / Polka-Dot Jersey

After his stage win today, Tadej Pogacar edges closer to Wout Poels who picked up mountains points earlier in the stage. Poels is going to have to work hard to keep this jersey with some big climbs coming up in the next few days.

1. Wout Poels - 78 points
2. Tadej Pogacar - 67 points
3. Nairo Quintana - 66 points
4. Michael Woods - 66 points
5. Wout van Aert - 64 points

Young Rider's Classification / White Jersey

The top three contenders in the fight for the White Jersey stayed the same today, but Sergio Higuita snuck his way in to 4th place after a strong ride on the Col du Portet, finishing 8th on the stage.

1. Tadej Pogačar
2. Jonas Vingegaard +5:39
3. David Gaudu +15:42
4. Sergio Higuita +1:02:18

 Team Classification

1. Bahrain Victorious
2. EF Education-Nippo +34:16
3. AG2R Citroen +50:26
4. Trek Segafredo +51:16
5. Team Jumbo Visma +55:45
